message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper is about improving context modeling for document-level neural machine translation, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The proposed method involves the use of capsule networks, which are a type of neural network architecture that has gained popularity in recent years in various NLP and computer vision tasks. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) are also likely sub-categories. The method also involves attention mechanisms, which are commonly used in NLP and machine learning in general, so cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category. Finally, the method involves clustering context information into different perspectives, which is a task that can be tackled using unsupervised learning techniques such as clustering algorithms, which fall under the category of neural networks and learning systems (cs.NE).
